reviewText: Terrific DVD, shorter time wise than I thought (22 minutes) but really packed with information and interviews with descendants of those who perished at Sand Creek.  Glad I purchased it.

Tells the painful story of Sand Creek.  Very few documentaries or movies about the massacre. It is one a few efforts to tell what happened not just at Sand Creek but all over the country and to the world's indigenous people.
This book is very close to my heart as there are still generational suvivors in my family.
